snippet: Franz J. Sedelmayer, a German security consultant, has known President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia since the 1990s, and fought Russia almost as long.
abstract: German security consultant Franz J Sedelmayer has emerged as rare victor over Kremlin's strong-arm legal tactics, wresting millions of dollars in compensation following 20-year legal battle over Russia's seizure of his St Petersburg offices; review of Sedelmayer's case shows how far Vladimir Putin's Russia is willing to go, including trumped-up countercharges and veiled threats, to defend its national interests.
lead_paragraph: Franz J. Sedelmayer, a German security consultant, has known President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia since the 1990s, and fought Russia almost as long.

headline.seo: Once Friendly With Putin, German Goes to Court Over Seized Assets
headline.main: Beating Russia at Its Own Long Game
headline.print_headline: Beating Russia at Its Own Long Game
